body_html: This is a bit out of my domain, but my suggestion would be to use a simple XOR or other obsfucation of the file on disk, and then at runtime load the file into memory, 'decrypt' that memory, and then deserialize the protobuf from RAM. This won't stop a determined malicious actor, but at least complicates the process for them, and at some point there will be an in-memory copy of the graph anyway, whatever you do.

body: This is a bit out of my domain, but my suggestion would be to use a simple XOR or other obsfucation of the file on disk, and then at runtime load the file into memory, 'decrypt' that memory, and then deserialize the protobuf from RAM. This won't stop a determined malicious actor, but at least complicates the process for them, and at some point there will be an in-memory copy of the graph anyway, whatever you do.
